Articles.Content:
Well, *H&S Tinkering Workshop* proudly announces that our tinkerers have finally learned normal mapping. And here is the first release:

***Di-Coupler***

***v1.1***

![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12669.0;attach=20420;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12669.0;attach=20420;image)

It may look a bit worn, but it still serves its purpose: attach *two* parallel stacks to your rocket or plane -- and then throw them away.

In version 1.1:

- [li]New, even moar detailed textures,[/li][li]Several cfg tweaks (incl. enabling fuel crossfeed; thanks **Tiberion!**).[/li]

[Download 1.2 Mb (must be logged in).](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12669.0;attach=20419)

***Warning! Requires KSP v0.15 or higher!***

[!\[64px-Cc-by_new.svg.png\](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Cc-by_new.svg/64px-Cc-by_new.svg.png)!\[64px-Cc-nc.svg.png\](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Cc-nc.svg/64px-Cc-nc.svg.png)!\[64px-Cc-nd.svg.png\](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/29/Cc-nd.svg/64px-Cc-nd.svg.png)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Creative_Commons_license)

(Sadly no *'share-alike'* this time, \'cause new KSP part format *technically* does not allow to create a derivative project.)

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-05T08:01:00Z" title="08/05/2012 08:01  AM" data-short="11 yr">August 5, 2012</time> by Tosh**
Now that looks pretty neat.

Just another craft: 

![index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12669.0;attach=20250;image](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?action=dlattach;topic=12669.0;attach=20250;image)

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Very cool, but then everything you make is brilliant.

> 
> Very cool, but then everything you make is brilliant.

Why, thanks))
It was just an exercise (and, well, a part for my standard Mun rocket, I\'ve gotten a bit tired of 3-way symmetry ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)). Now I can add normal mapping to my other parts...

And I wonder which one goes first =P

The one that\'s awesome?

Wait they all are...
Is there a way I can get symmetry in SPH to work with this?

Very good, just today I was thinking 'hey, we could really use 2-way and 4-way couplers besides the old tricoupler'. Very well!

(Do you have a 4-way also?)

> 
> Is there a way I can get symmetry in SPH to work with this?

Sadly, no ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Do you have a 4-way also?)

I don\'t, but NovaPunch pack *may* have; try it out.

there\'s a a few 2way and 1 4way in NP, yes, but they currently have a fuel bug in them (needs a config tweak)

I see this one doesn\'t have it either; Did you check that it pulls fuel for both engines through the decoupler?

The stock Tricoupler now has this: 

// keeps fuel from flowing FROM the bottom nodes (prevents stack imbalances and such)

NoCrossFeedNodeKey = bottom

Otherwise it only pulls fuel for one of the 3 engines attached.

> 
> The stock Tricoupler now has this: 
> // keeps fuel from flowing FROM the bottom nodes (prevents stack imbalances and such)
> 
> NoCrossFeedNodeKey = bottom

Thanks a lot! I\'ll do some tests and update a file.

I thought novapunch also had one of these

Edit:Nice job as always though!
This is definitely designed for planes. How about an aviation pack, tosh?

> 
> This is definitely designed for planes. How about an aviation pack, tosh?

C7 do such a stuff way better ;P
Nice. Im surprised no one as done this sooner. Thx! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

This is a really neat model!

You oughto take a look at the dual couplers in NovaPunch, since symmetry works with those, and that\'s pretty handy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> 
> You oughto take a look at the dual couplers in NovaPunch, since symmetry works with those, and that\'s pretty handy ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

\*Upon looking at NP configs\* Ah, you mean 

    stackSymmetry = 1

.CFG parameter? Yep, thanks, it works. 

I\'ll include this tweak into the next release.
When I try to put it on my plane its not on the side like yours.. It faces up, vertical :S What am I doing wrong?
Did you rotate it? Manual part rotation is a requirement now...

> 
> Did you rotate it? Manual part rotation is a requirement now...

UPD: use <wasdqe> keys. Or <shift +="" wasdqe=""> for precise rotation.
</shift></wasdqe>
